sentences.english: Thought you might be needin’ a swig or two.
Miners knocking back middies in Port Hedland yesterday had reason to cheer.
sentences.chinese: 昨日在黑德蘭港痛飲的礦工們有理由歡呼。

sentences.english: That night we partied until dawn.
The day Bunkie was fired there was great rejoicing and much drinking of champagne.
sentences.chinese: 邦奇被解僱的那天，大家歡欣鼓舞，痛飲香檳。

sentences.english: A young couple was out carousing one evening.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，一對年輕夫婦出門痛飲。

sentences.english: THIRST】The horse satisfied its thirst at the river.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬在河邊痛飲解渴。

sentences.english: Wassail toast, simultaneous praise of Auld Lang Syne.
sentences.chinese: 舉杯痛飲，同聲歌頌友誼地久天長。

sentences.english: He swills a cup of wine.
One day is carousing in ward, this lets one fragrant age beautiful nurse sees.
sentences.chinese: 一日正在病房痛飲，這讓一芳齡美麗的護士看到。

sentences.english: They spent the whole afternoon in the restaurant boozing up.
sentences.chinese: 他們整個下午都在餐館裏痛飲。

sentences.english: Some drink from the fountain of knowledge; this person only gargled.
sentences.chinese: 我們痛飲知識的甘泉，這個人只是用來漱口。

sentences.english: Let us fill ourselves with costly wine, and ointments: and let not the flower of the time pass by us.
sentences.chinese: 我們要痛飲美酒，濃施香液，莫讓春花空空溜過。

sentences.english: Then they sat down in the great dining hall to drink.
sentences.chinese: 然後便在樓下的大飯廳裏坐下痛飲了起來。

sentences.english: They told him to stay home with his wife instead of going out and carousing with friends.
sentences.chinese: 他們告訴他待在家裏陪老婆，不要與朋友出去痛飲。

sentences.english: He quaffed the swelling rapture of life from the foaming goblet of the infinite .
sentences.chinese: 他從那穹蒼的起泡的杯中，痛飲充滿生命的狂喜。

sentences.english: The horse satisfied its thirst at the river.

definition: lit. cool breeze and bright moon (idiom)/fig. peaceful and clear night/(allusively) living a solitary and quiet life
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
lit. sing to accompany wine (idiom); fig. life is short, make merry while you can
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
